azure-fabric:position-deletes:v2.notes: OneLake virtualizes Iceberg tables as Delta Lake using Apache XTable, which converts positional delete files during Iceberg-to-Delta conversion
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Position deletes are translated during metadata virtualization; not a native Iceberg engine

azure-fabric:position-deletes:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric; Microsoft is actively working on V3 compatibility
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Equality delete support depends on the Apache XTable virtualization layer that converts Iceberg metadata to Delta Lake format
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Equality delete handling depends on XTable conversion fidelity

azure-fabric:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:merge-on-read:v2.notes: When reading external Iceberg tables via shortcuts, merge-on-read is handled by the XTable virtualization layer converting to Delta Lake
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Fabric uses Delta Lake merge strategies internally, not Iceberg MoR

azure-fabric:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Fabric uses Delta Lake copy-on-write internally; when Delta tables are virtualized as Iceberg, the underlying CoW behavior is preserved
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
CoW is the underlying Delta Lake behavior, not native Iceberg CoW

azure-fabric:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Schema evolution works on the Delta Lake side; for Iceberg shortcuts, metadata changes may not be immediately reflected until a data change occurs
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Iceberg metadata changes (add/drop/rename columns) may require a data change to trigger re-conversion

azure-fabric:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

Partitioning is translated between formats during virtualization

azure-fabric:time-travel:v2.notes: Time travel is available on Delta Lake tables within Fabric; for Iceberg shortcuts virtualized as Delta, time travel operates on the Delta log, not Iceberg snapshots
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Time travel operates on virtualized Delta log, not native Iceberg snapshot history

azure-fabric:time-travel:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Fabric provides automatic optimization (compaction, V-Order) for Delta Lake tables; for Iceberg shortcuts, maintenance must be performed by the source Iceberg writer
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Auto-optimization applies to Delta tables only; Iceberg shortcuts require external maintenance

azure-fabric:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Fabric does not support Iceberg branching and tagging; Fabric uses Delta Lake natively which does not have equivalent branch/tag features

azure-fabric:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric; branching/tagging also not supported
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support for Iceberg tables via OneLake shortcuts with automatic metadata virtualization to Delta Lake (GA). Also supports Delta-to-Iceberg virtualization for external Iceberg readers. OneLake-Snowflake bidirectional Iceberg read is GA as of Jan 2026.
caveats: Not all Iceberg data types are supported (e.g., time type); some type width issues with certain numeric types
Iceberg time data type is not supported
Private links not supported; some region restrictions (Qatar Central, Norway West)

azure-fabric:read-support:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric; V3 compatibility is actively being developed
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:write-insert:v2.notes: Fabric writes Delta Lake tables natively, which are auto-virtualized as Iceberg for external readers. External tools (e.g., Snowflake) can write Iceberg tables directly to OneLake. Fabric itself does not write native Iceberg format.
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Fabric engines write Delta Lake, not native Iceberg; external Iceberg writers (Snowflake) can write directly to OneLake

azure-fabric:write-insert:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: DML operations (MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE) operate on Delta Lake tables within Fabric; changes are reflected in the virtualized Iceberg view. No native Iceberg DML from Fabric engines.
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
DML is Delta Lake-based; Iceberg view is read-only from Fabric perspective

azure-fabric:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

Only read-only metadata operations supported; catalog write operations not yet available

azure-synapse:statistics:v2.notes: Column statistics supported via Spark pools with manually installed iceberg-spark-runtime JAR. Statistics are written to manifest files via the standard Iceberg write path. Not available in serverless or dedicated SQL pools.
caveats: Iceberg is not pre-installed; requires manual JAR package installation on Spark pools
Only available via Spark pools; serverless SQL pool and dedicated SQL pool have no Iceberg support

azure-synapse:statistics:v3.notes: Depends on the iceberg-spark-runtime version installed by the user; Synapse has no official V3 documentation or support
caveats: No official Synapse documentation for Iceberg V3
V3 support depends entirely on user-installed Iceberg library version

azure-synapse:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Parquet-level bloom filters can be enabled via Iceberg table properties when using Spark pools with manually installed iceberg-spark-runtime JAR. Not available in SQL pools.
caveats: Iceberg is not pre-installed; requires manual JAR package installation on Spark pools
Requires setting bloom filter table properties per column
Not available in serverless or dedicated SQL pools

azure-synapse:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Depends on the iceberg-spark-runtime version installed by the user; Synapse has no official V3 documentation or support
caveats: No official Synapse documentation for Iceberg V3
V3 support depends entirely on user-installed Iceberg library version

azure-fabric:statistics:v2.notes: When Fabric virtualizes Delta Lake tables as Iceberg via Apache XTable, column statistics are translated from Delta Lake statistics to Iceberg manifest statistics. For external Iceberg tables read via OneLake shortcuts, existing statistics are preserved.
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization (Apache XTable) — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg
Statistics quality depends on the Delta-to-Iceberg virtualization fidelity

azure-fabric:statistics:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-fabric:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Fabric does not support Iceberg bloom filters. Delta Lake tables virtualized as Iceberg do not include bloom filter metadata in the Iceberg representation.
caveats: Iceberg support is via metadata virtualization — Fabric natively uses Delta Lake, not Iceberg

azure-fabric:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Iceberg V3 not yet supported; Microsoft is actively working toward V3 compatibility

azure-synapse:type-promotion:v2.notes: Type promotion supported via Spark pools with manually installed Iceberg runtime. Supports int to long, float to double, and decimal precision widening when using Spark's ALTER TABLE ALTER COLUMN TYPE.
caveats: Requires manual installation of iceberg-spark-runtime in Spark pools
Not available in Synapse Serverless SQL pools (read-only for Iceberg)

azure-synapse:type-promotion:v3.notes: Depends on the iceberg-spark-runtime version installed by the user; Synapse has not officially announced V3 support
caveats: Synapse V3 support not officially announced

azure-fabric:type-promotion:v2.notes: Microsoft Fabric accesses Iceberg tables via read-only shortcuts. Type promotion cannot be performed through Fabric; it must be done externally.
caveats: Fabric only supports read-only access to Iceberg tables via OneLake shortcuts
Type promotions must be performed using an external engine

azure-fabric:type-promotion:v3.notes: Iceberg V3 is not yet supported in Microsoft Fabric
caveats: Fabric does not support Iceberg V3
